title: How to Record WhatsApp Calls on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Download a screen recording app from the App Store.
steps.content: Download a screen recording app from the App Store. Although your iPhone or iPad has built-in screen recording software, it may not be able to fully capture video calls on WhatsApp. If you’re unable to record your calls with audio, try a third-party option instead. Download a screen recording app from the App Store . Some popular screen recording apps include Loom Screen Recorder (free with limitations) and Record It! (requires a subscription to use most features).

steps.title: Open the app and follow the instructions to start recording.
steps.content: Open the app and follow the instructions to start recording. These apps vary slightly, but they tend to have a fairly similar interface from one app to another. If you’re using Loom, tap the Screen tab at the bottom of the screen, then make sure the mic is set to On . Tap Start Broadcast to begin the recording. [1] X Research source You’ll see a red bar at the top left corner of the screen once recording starts. This bar will also tell you how much time has passed since you started recording.

steps.title: Make your video call on WhatsApp.
steps.content: Make your video call on WhatsApp . You can also start the screen recording process after you’ve already started a call.

steps.title: Tap the red recording bar to stop recording.
steps.content: Tap the red recording bar to stop recording. When you’re done recording your call, tap the red bar at the top right corner of the screen. This will immediately end the recording. You can generally view your screen capture videos from inside the screen recording app.

steps.title: Tap on the Settings icon .
steps.content: Tap on the Settings icon . While you might be able to partially capture WhatsApp video calls with your iPhone or iPad’s built-in screen recorder, many users are unable to record audio this way. If you want to try it anyway, we’ll explain how to do it. First, you’ll need to add the screen recorder button to your Control Center. Start by opening the Settings app. If you can't find the Settings icon, swipe right on your device's home screen until you get to the App Library and type "Settings" in the search bar at the top of the screen. Tap the icon when it appears in the search results.

steps.title: Tap Control Center.
steps.content: Tap Control Center .

steps.title: Tap the icon next to Screen Recording.
steps.content: Tap the icon next to Screen Recording . Scroll down to the More Controls header to see a list of apps that aren’t already in your Control Center. Tap the + next to Screen Recording to add it to the Included Controls list.

steps.title: Return to your home screen.
steps.content: Return to your home screen. Depending on your device, you can do this by pressing the Home button or swiping up on the screen.

steps.title: Tap the WhatsApp icon to open it.
steps.content: Tap the WhatsApp icon to open it. The icon looks like a white phone handset inside a white speech bubble on a green background. If you can't find the WhatsApp icon, swipe right on your device's home screen and type "WhatsApp" in the search bar at the top of the screen. Tap the WhatsApp icon when it appears in the search results.

steps.title: Tap Calls.
steps.content: Tap Calls . The Calls icon, which looks like a phone, appears on the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the New Call icon in the upper right corner of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the New Call icon in the upper right corner of the screen. The icon looks like a + sign.

steps.title: Tap the video camera icon next to the contact you wish to call.
steps.content: Tap the video camera icon next to the contact you wish to call. WhatsApp makes a video connection to this contact. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Swipe down from the top right corner of your screen.
steps.content: Swipe down from the top right corner of your screen. This reveals the Control Center screen. You should see the icon here. On certain iOS devices, you can open the Control Center by swiping up from the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Long-press on the icon.
steps.content: Long-press on the icon.

steps.title: Tap the microphone icon near the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the microphone icon near the bottom of the screen. This turns the microphone from off to on, allowing Screen Recording to capture audio as well as video. The microphone may not work with WhatsApp and other apps that restrict your iPhone’s screen recording features.

steps.title: Tap Start Recording.
steps.content: Tap Start Recording . After three seconds, Screen Recording begins recording all activity on your screen. A red banner appears at the top of your screen when Screen Recording is active.

steps.title: Tap the red banner when you are ready to end the recording.
steps.content: Tap the red banner when you are ready to end the recording. Your iPhone prompts you to confirm that you wish to stop Screen Recording.

steps.title: Tap Stop to end the recording session.
steps.content: Tap Stop to end the recording session. You can find your completed Screen Recording by tapping the Camera app and tapping your Photo Library. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Grab a second device with a mic.
steps.content: Grab a second device with a mic. If you aren’t able to get around WhatsApp’s restrictions, you can always record the call externally. Since you shouldn’t have any trouble recording the video from your call using your iPhone or iPad’s built-in screen recorder, all you really need to capture is the sound. You can use another phone or tablet, a computer with a mic, or a standalone digital recording device. Apple devices have a built-in recording app called Voice Memos. On a Windows computer or Android device, you can use the native Voice Recorder app.

steps.title: Start recording your call.
steps.content: Start recording your call. If you want, use the {{#Using Your Built-in Screen Recorder|screen recorder}} method to capture the video from your WhatsApp call. At the same time, start recording the sound on your external device. Stop both recordings when you’re done.

steps.title: Edit the sound and video together.
steps.content: Edit the sound and video together. If you want to be able to listen to the audio and watch the video of the call at the same time, you can easily add your recorded audio to your video using any basic video editing app. Add the audio track on your iPhone or iPad with iMovie. Email or AirDrop the recording to yourself or upload it to a cloud service so you can access it on your device. You can also transfer both files to a computer and add the sound using a desktop video editing app.
